intro: Trichocline tweediei, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, surrounded by narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Trichocline tweediei is often found in fynbos vegetation, a unique type of shrubland ecosystem.
